item.title: First Post!
item.description:
Hello World, welcome to NOME BLOG,

My name is Eugenio Palmieri and I’m starting a new personal blog. I’m a Master’s student in Statistics at Florence University (Italy) and I want to write mainly about statistics, informatics and programming1, but I’m interested also in economics, politics, urban planning, mathematics and other nerdy topics.

Feautures of the blog:

Integration with R:

One of the main feauture of this blog is that it supports Rmarkdown files, which make it possible to create post from Rstudio to generate directly graphs, tables and interactive html widgets with R2, like in this graph example:

library(ggplot2)

data=data.frame(cond = rep(c("condition_1", "condition_2"), each=10), my_x = 1:100 + rnorm(100,sd=9), my_y = 1:100 + rnorm(100,sd=16) )

ggplot(data, aes(x=my_x, y=my_y)) + geom_point(shape=1) +  
geom_smooth(method=lm , color="red", se=TRUE)

Support for \(\rm \LaTeX\) math expressions:

Anothere important feauture is the support for \(\rm \LaTeX\) to write equations and formulas:

$$\mathbf{y} = \mathbf{X}\boldsymbol\beta + \boldsymbol\varepsilon$$

\[\mathbf{y} = \mathbf{X}\boldsymbol\beta + \boldsymbol\varepsilon\]

Build your own blog for free!

If you are interested in building a blog like this for free, you can read the new post I’ve made to explain how to create a blog with Hugo and Github with the blogdown package, directly from Rstudio.

  1. I’m using mainly R with RStudio, but I have some basic experience with Stata, Systat, GeoDa, Qgis, Markdown, Rmarkdown, LaTex and I’m intentioned to learn Python.↩

  2. R is a a free software environment for statistical computing and graphics and Rstudio is an integrated development environment (IDE) for R.↩
